column4: is there any reason why a default install of ubuntu would not let me ssh in ?
after install ssh
yep and running
no. default install
no router
yep
what error message do you get? and how are you trying to ssh in?
what error message do you get? and how are you trying to ssh in?
non it jsut hangs
run nmap localhost -p 22 and tell us what you get
bash: localhost: command not found
nmap localhost -p 22
what does the command "ssh localhost" do
ok, so you have a firewall that is blocking ssh
i can conncet to myself fine
have you done any firewall configurations? ufw or the like?
so sudo iptables -L and post in a pastebin
that is the problem, the firewall config that you have done
awesome, now im getting connection refused errors (which is way better)
firewall?
no wonder, and by default there are no open ports so i don't see why you need to do that
and also outgoing connections on all ports are usually allowed by default
